neighbors.name: Everett Jones Lumber Corporation
neighbors.claims: Everett Jones Lumber Corp is a local timber company and sawmill operation based in Spotsylvania, VA ([SAFER Web](https://safer.fmcsa.dot.gov/query.asp?searchtype=ANY&query_type=queryCarrierSnapshot&query_param=USDOT&query_string=118987)). The company has been historically led by the Jones family, including Everett "Burt" Jones Jr. (husband of the late Shirley B. Jones, former secretary/treasurer) ([Free Lance-Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/shirley-jones-obituary?id=33142722)). In 2004, the corporation was the plaintiff in a Virginia Supreme Court case (`Amstutz v. Everett Jones Lumber Corp`) regarding a prescriptive easement dispute to ensure logging access to their properties via Brightwell Road ([FindLaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/court/va-supreme-court/1050575.html)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Established local business with history of defending property access rights

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via corporate leadership. Given the 2004 litigation regarding road access, prioritize discussions about road maintenance, easement protections, and hauling routes. Address commercial forestry interests directly.

citations.claim: Everett Jones Lumber Corp is a local timber company and sawmill operation
citations.title: SAFER Web - Company Snapshot EVERETT JONES LUMBER CORP

citations.claim: Company led by Jones family including Everett 'Burt' Jones Jr.
citations.title: Shirley Jones Obituary - Fredericksburg, VA

citations.claim: Plaintiff in 2004 Supreme Court case regarding prescriptive easement
citations.title: Amstutz v. Everett Jones Lumber Corp.

neighbors.name: Carrie W. Atkins
neighbors.claims: The property is associated with the Atkins family, though Carrie W. (Ann) Atkins passed away in May 2012 ([Johnson Funeral Home](https://www.johnsonfuneralhomeandcrematory.com/obituaries/Carrie-Ann-Atkins?obId=1996230)). Her late husband, Harry Atkins Sr., was a lifelong Spotsylvania resident who died in 2001 and was buried in the Atkins family private cemetery located in Spotsylvania ([Free Lance-Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/harry-atkins-obituary?id=13096203)). Surviving family members include her son, Harry Atkins Jr., and daughters Tammy and Doris, who have resided in the county ([Johnson Funeral Home](https://www.johnsonfuneralhomeandcrematory.com/obituaries/Carrie-Ann-Atkins?obId=1996230)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Deceased landowner; property likely held by estate/heirs

approach_recommendations.engage: Carrie Atkins is deceased (2012). Direct outreach to her son, Harry Atkins Jr., or the estate executor. Acknowledge the family cemetery on the premises and assure protections for this sensitive cultural feature.

citations.claim: Carrie W. (Ann) Atkins passed away in May 2012
citations.title: Obituary for Carrie Ann Atkins

citations.claim: Harry Atkins Sr. died in 2001 and was buried in private family cemetery
citations.title: Harry Atkins Obituary (2001)

citations.claim: Surviving children include Harry Atkins Jr., Tammy, and Doris
citations.title: Obituary for Carrie Ann Atkins

neighbors.name: Lenora Burke Gummel
neighbors.claims: Lenora Burke Gummel is a Spotsylvania landowner with limited public profile regarding development. While other large-scale solar projects in the county (e.g., sPower) have generated significant public comment from neighbors, there is no public record of Gummel taking a vocal stance in media reports surrounding those events ([Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/)). Public records searches yield no evidence of elected office or board membership in Spotsylvania County.
neighbors.influence_justification: No known public roles or documented advocacy

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a low-information stakeholder. Use standard introductory materials. Lack of prior public comment suggests a preference for privacy; avoid aggressive solicitation.

citations.claim: Context of local solar opposition (sPower) where owner was not named as a participant
citations.title: Virginia’s biggest proposed solar project is also among the most contentious local land-use fights

neighbors.name: Rettie J. Harding
neighbors.claims: Rettie J. Harding is a long-time resident of Spotsylvania County, listed as the owner of the property at 8853 Pamunkey Rd ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/h/rettie-harding/)). This address corresponds with parcel data in the surrounding Pamunkey Road area ([Realtor.com](https://www.realtor.com/realestateandhomes-detail/8853-Pamunkey-Rd_Spotsylvania_VA_22551_M52979-45893)). Public records indicate she is part of the local Atkins family, being the sister of the late Harry Atkins, a lifelong Spotsylvania resident ([Free Lance-Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/harry-atkins-obituary?id=13096203)). No evidence of public participation in zoning hearings or development comments was found.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private resident with local family ties but no documented public leadership roles.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage by acknowledging her long-standing family roots in the county. Focus on visual buffers and maintaining the quiet rural character of her property, as she appears to be a private resident without commercial interests.

citations.claim: Rettie J. Harding is a long-time resident of Spotsylvania County, listed as the owner of the property at 8853 Pamunkey Rd
citations.title: Rettie Harding - Spotsylvania, VA Public Record

citations.claim: This address corresponds with parcel data in the surrounding Pamunkey Road area
citations.title: Property Details: 8853 Pamunkey Rd, Spotsylvania, VA

citations.claim: Public records indicate she is part of the local Atkins family, being the sister of the late Harry Atkins
citations.title: Obituary: Harry Atkins

neighbors.name: Rose Lee Gilbert
neighbors.claims: Rose Lee Gilbert (also listed as Rose L. Gilbert) is a resident of Spotsylvania County associated with the property at 8885 Pamunkey Rd ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/g/rose-gilbert/)). She is the wife of Jack Gilbert; the Gilbert family has a presence in the area, with relatives owning adjacent or nearby properties ([Free Lance-Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/sylvia-gilbert-obituary?id=12533611)). There is no record of her speaking publicly on solar or land use development in available county minutes.
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-term resident with extended family in the area; no public office found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with respect for family legacy, noting that other Gilbert family members live nearby. Assure her that the project will not disrupt family property cohesion or degrade the inheritance value of the land.

citations.claim: Rose Lee Gilbert is a resident of Spotsylvania County associated with the property at 8885 Pamunkey Rd
citations.title: Rose Gilbert - Spotsylvania, VA Public Record

citations.claim: She is the wife of Jack Gilbert; the Gilbert family has a presence in the area
citations.title: Obituary: Sylvia A. Gilbert (Granddaughter)

neighbors.name: Sharon Crabtree
neighbors.claims: Sharon Crabtree is the recorded owner of the property at 8834 Pamunkey Rd (Parcel 44-A-10E), which she purchased in June 2025 ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/VA/Spotsylvania/8834-Pamunkey-Rd-22551/home/15585215)) ([Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/8834-pamunkey-rd-spotsylvania-va/n8kzx0mxp4cjm/)). She is a prominent local educator who founded the 'Learn 'n Play' Preschool in Spotsylvania in 1988, a business that emphasizes nature-based learning and outdoor play on wooded acreage ([Learn 'n Play](https://www.learnnplay.com/about-us)). While she has not taken a documented public stance on solar development, her professional philosophy highlights a connection to nature and wooded environments.
neighbors.influence_justification: Founder of long-standing local preschool serving 100+ families; respected educator.

approach_recommendations.engage: Leverage her background in education and nature. Frame the project's landscaping plan as a way to support local biodiversity (pollinators) and maintain the 'wooded' aesthetic she values. Avoid technical jargon; focus on environmental stewardship.

citations.claim: Sharon Crabtree is the recorded owner of the property at 8834 Pamunkey Rd (Parcel 44-A-10E), which she purchased in June 2025
citations.title: Property History: 8834 Pamunkey Rd

citations.claim: She is a prominent local educator who founded the 'Learn 'n Play' Preschool in Spotsylvania in 1988
citations.title: About Us - Learn 'n Play Preschool

neighbors.name: Garet Meyer
neighbors.claims: Garet Meyer (also spelled Garrett Meyer) is identified as a resident of Spotsylvania County in public records ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/m/beverly-meyer/)). No public records were found indicating Meyer has taken a position on local development or energy projects in Spotsylvania County.
neighbors.influence_justification: No public roles or civic leadership positions found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Conduct personal outreach to establish contact, as Meyer has no documented public stance. Verify preferred name spelling (Garet vs. Garrett) during initial interaction.

citations.claim: Identified as a resident of Spotsylvania County
citations.title: Beverly Meyer - National Public Data

neighbors.name: Phillip Jerome & Shelby Noel Scarbro
neighbors.claims: Phillip and Shelby Scarbro are residents of Spotsylvania County, associated with the property at 8873 Pamunkey Rd, which corresponds to tax parcel 44-4-C ([Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/8873-pamunkey-rd-spotsylvania-va/hvv0hbldlpmr6/)). Phillip Scarbro has a documented address history at this location ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/s/phillip-scarbro/)). Family obituaries confirm the relationship between Phillip Jerome Scarbro and Shelby Noel Scarbro ([Covenant Funeral Service](https://www.covenantfuneralservice.com/obituaries/Stuart-Edward-Payne-Jr?obId=32468394)). Neither has been identified in local government minutes or media as voicing opinions on development or clean energy projects.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private residents with no identified public offices.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Scarbro household through direct, friendly outreach. They have deep family ties in the region but no known history of opposing development.

neighbors.name: Jerry Joan Hughes & Julian Gonzalez
neighbors.claims: Jerry Hughes and Julian Gonzalez are identified as associated with Spotsylvania County. A Julian Gonzalez is listed as the President of Career Central in Spotsylvania, VA ([SlideShare](https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/enet-recruiter-whos-who-in-high-tech-recruiting-guidebook-spring-2014/31685301)). Jerry Hughes is a registered real estate agent operating in Spotsylvania ([Realtor.com](https://www.realtor.com/realestateagents/5673970bbb954c010067c2d2)). They have not made any known public comments on development issues, and their names do not appear in coverage of community debates on recent projects.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local business owner and real estate professional.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with professional courtesy given their likely familiarity with local real estate and business sectors. Focus on property value protection and community benefits.

citations.claim: Julian Gonzalez listed as President of Career Central in Spotsylvania
citations.title: Who's Who in High Tech Recruiting

citations.claim: Jerry Hughes is a real estate agent in Spotsylvania

neighbors.name: Della Lu Brooks, Megan Lee Brooks & Morgan Marie Brooks
neighbors.claims: The Brooks family co-owns property on Alva Brooks Lane, a road named after their ancestor, Alva Brooks [The Free Lance-Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/elnora-brooks-obituary?id=16415611). The family property contains a residential dwelling built circa 2011 on a lot exceeding 1 acre [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/13328-Alva-Brooks-Ln-Spotsylvania-VA-22551/64536987_zpid/). Public records indicate the property is part of a legacy holding, with family members (such as Meagan) mentioned in local obituaries as long-time area residents [The Free Lance-Star](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/elnora-brooks-obituary?id=16415611). No references were found of these specific Brooks family members speaking in local hearings or media about development issues [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/27/hundreds-pack-into-contentious-spotsylvania-meeting-on-solar-project-supervisors-delay-decision/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local landowners with family road naming rights

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected community member acknowledge their family’s long local history and emphasize how any project plans respect their land legacy and continuity.

citations.claim: Alva Brooks Lane named after ancestor Alva Brooks
citations.title: Elnora Brooks Obituary - The Free Lance-Star

citations.claim: Property details (1.17 acres, built 2011)

citations.claim: No public stance found in local hearings
citations.title: Spotsylvania Solar Hearing Coverage

neighbors.name: Anthony Gaudet & Brenda G. Gaudet
neighbors.claims: Anthony and Brenda G. Gaudet are the recorded owners of a 5.28-acre residential property at 8861 Pamunkey Road in Spotsylvania, which they acquired in 2017 [Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/8861-pamunkey-rd-spotsylvania-va/60fhqdebjy3w3/). The property features a 3-bedroom, 2-bath house built in 2000 [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/8861-Pamunkey-Rd-Spotsylvania-VA-22551/64813243_zpid/). While there are records of Gaudet family members in Louisiana, definitive migration details for this specific couple could not be verified in the current scope; however, their ownership of the Spotsylvania property is confirmed via tax records [Homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/8861-pamunkey-rd-spotsylvania-va/60fhqdebjy3w3/). They have not been identified in local news or meeting minutes as speaking out on development or energy projects [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/27/hundreds-pack-into-contentious-spotsylvania-meeting-on-solar-project-supervisors-delay-decision/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private residents; no public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Gaudets one-on-one with factual information, emphasizing that their rural peace and property value will be maintained. Personal outreach respecting their desire for a quiet environment is likely to resonate.

neighbors.name: Tammy Newton Pavey
neighbors.claims: Tammy Newton Pavey is associated with a residential parcel on Alva Brooks Lane in Spotsylvania, featuring a 1,256 sq ft home [Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/VA/Spotsylvania/5128-Ridge-Rd-22551/home/22886049). Local obituaries confirm she is part of the Newton family, long-time residents of Spotsylvania [Legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/donna-newton-obituary?id=12477439). While family members (Steve Pavey) have petitioned the county regarding utility infrastructure (broadband) [DHCD VA](https://www.dhcd.virginia.gov/sites/default/files/Docx/vati/archives/1-fiberlync-vati-application.pdf), there is no public record of Ms. Pavey herself taking a visible stance on local development or energy projects [Virginia Mercury](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/27/hundreds-pack-into-contentious-spotsylvania-meeting-on-solar-project-supervisors-delay-decision/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local resident; family has engaged on utility issues

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect with Ms. Pavey through a neighborly conversation, acknowledging her family's tenure in the community. Emphasize that plans will not disrupt the quiet character of the area.

neighbors.name: Commonwealth of Virginia Board of Game & Inland Fisheries (now Department of Wildlife Resources)
neighbors.claims: The Commonwealth of Virginia’s Board of Game & Inland Fisheries (renamed the Department of Wildlife Resources or DWR in 2020) is the state agency responsible for managing inland wildlife and fisheries ([Virginia DWR](https://www.virginia.gov/agencies/department-of-game-and-inland-fisheries/)). In 2017, the agency paid $9 million for roughly 2,900 acres in western Spotsylvania County to establish the Oakley Forest Wildlife Management Area (WMA) ([Outdoors Rambler](https://www.outdoorsrambler.com/post/2017/11/29/virginia-opening-wildlife-management-area-in-spotsylvania-county-needed-access)). By 2023, the Oakley Forest WMA had expanded to approximately 4,459 acres ([Virginia DWR](https://dwr.virginia.gov/wma/oakley-forest/)). The DWR provides regulatory guidance for solar energy facilities, recommending specific wildlife protection measures such as perimeter fencing standards (maximum 61 inches or minimum 96 inches) to prevent deer entrapment and the preservation of native vegetative buffers ([Virginia DWR](https://dwr.virginia.gov/wp-content/uploads/media/Solar-Energy-Facility-Guidance.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State regulatory agency and owner of ~4,459 acres (Oakley Forest WMA) in county.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate through DWR Environmental Services staff regarding wildlife corridor mapping, pollinator plantings, and fencing specifications to ensure regulatory compliance.

citations.claim: Renamed to Department of Wildlife Resources in 2020
citations.title: Virginia Department of Wildlife Resources Agency Overview

citations.claim: Paid $9 million for 2,900 acres in 2017
citations.title: Virginia Opening Wildlife Management Area in Spotsylvania County

citations.claim: Oakley Forest WMA expanded to 4,459 acres
citations.title: Oakley Forest Wildlife Management Area

citations.claim: Issues solar facility guidance on fencing and buffers
citations.title: Solar Energy Facility Construction and Operation Recommendations

neighbors.name: Cherry Tree Timber LLC C/O Property Tax Administration
neighbors.claims: Cherry Tree Timber LLC is a foreign-owned land holding entity (United Kingdom) [VDACS](https://www.vdacs.virginia.gov/pdf/annual-report-on-foreign-owned-land.pdf) managed by the Molpus Woodlands Group, a major timber investment management organization [Molpus](https://www.molpus.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ValueAdded_LandSale_Img_PEN_CTTVALS0001.pdf). The company's mailing address in Jackson, MS corresponds to the Molpus headquarters, confirming its status as an investment vehicle rather than a local operator [King William County](https://www.kwc.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1106/2021LandUseCounty). While the entity has not publicly commented on the Spotsylvania solar project, it has demonstrated active engagement in land-use zoning in other Virginia counties (e.g., Nottoway County) to secure special exceptions for revenue-generating activities like hunting leases [Nottoway County](https://cms8.revize.com/revize/nottowaycountyva/03192024%20Staff%20Packet.pdf). This behavior indicates a rational economic approach to land asset management rather than ideological opposition to development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee commercial owner managed by a third-party investment firm (Molpus); no evidence of local political leadership or community organizing in Spotsylvania.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Molpus Woodlands Group directly, as they manage the asset. Position the solar development as a compatible land use or a divestment opportunity that aligns with their timber investment cycle. They are sophisticated financial actors likely to respond to ROI arguments rather than community sentiment.

citations.title: Annual Report on Foreign Ownership of Agricultural Land

citations.claim: managed by the Molpus Woodlands Group, a major timber investment management organization
citations.title: Molpus Woodlands Group Property Flyer

citations.claim: demonstrated active engagement in land-use zoning in other Virginia counties (e.g., Nottoway County) to secure special exceptions
citations.title: Nottoway County Board of Supervisors Staff Packet

neighbors.name: GTP Acquisition Partners II LLC C/O Property Tax Dept
neighbors.claims: GTP Acquisition Partners II, LLC is a subsidiary of American Tower Corporation, a major global telecommunications real estate investment trust [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). The entity functions as a holding company for tower assets and is listed as a subsidiary in American Tower's SEC filings [SEC](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1053507/000105350721000026/exhibit21fy2020.htm). Its primary business activity involves leasing antenna space to government agencies and wireless carriers [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). There is no record of this entity engaging in local land use advocacy in Spotsylvania; its interests are likely strictly limited to the technical non-interference of its tower infrastructure.
neighbors.influence_justification: Corporate subsidiary with no local personnel or community presence; influence is limited to federal/technical telecommunications rights.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with American Tower’s site management team regarding technical specifications (setbacks, glare analysis) to ensure the solar array does not impact tower operations. Confirming non-interference will likely secure a neutral position.

citations.claim: subsidiary of American Tower Corporation, a major global telecommunications real estate investment trust
citations.title: GovTribe Vendor Profile: GTP Acquisition Partners II LLC

citations.claim: listed as a subsidiary in American Tower's SEC filings
citations.title: American Tower Corp SEC Exhibit 21

citations.claim: leasing antenna space to government agencies and wireless carriers
citations.title: GovTribe Federal Contract Awards

neighbors.name: George A Sr & Kathryn B Reina Co-Tr George A Reina Sr Living Trust
neighbors.claims: This entity appears to be a private family trust holding residential or agricultural property. Comprehensive searches of Spotsylvania County Board of Supervisors minutes, planning commission records, and local media letters to the editor yielded no public statements, testimony, or positions regarding solar development associated with this trust or the named trustees.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family trust; no public record of community leadership or political involvement found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via standard resident outreach protocols (mailers/open house invitations). No specific data suggests high risk or specific leverage points.

neighbors.name: Merlin Bailey Trustee Merlin M Bailey Living Trust
neighbors.claims: The Merlin M. Bailey Living Trust is the recorded owner of multiple parcels in Spotsylvania County, including PINs 44A-10B, 44A-10C, and 44A-10D [Spotsylvania County Assessment Office](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/505/2025-Assessment-Search). Parcel 44A-10D corresponds to the property at 8840 Pamunkey Road, which consists of approximately 11.13 acres [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/8840-Pamunkey-Rd-Spotsylvania-VA-22551/64428468_zpid/). Public records associate the Bailey Living Trust with a Spotsylvania mailing address in the 22551 zip code area [King William County Land Book 2020](https://www.kwc.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1116/2020LandBookCounty). There is no record of commercial development projects or active business operations associated with these specific tax parcels [Spotsylvania County Assessment Office](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/505/2025-Assessment-Search). Searches of local news archives and public meeting minutes yielded no results indicating the trust or its trustee has taken a public stance on renewable energy or land use development in the county [Fredericksburg Free Lance–Star](https://fredericksburg.com).
neighbors.influence_justification: Entity appears to be a private family landholding trust with no documented political involvement, board memberships, or public advocacy roles in Spotsylvania County.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the trustee via mail at the registered address, focusing on the preservation of the rural character of the Pamunkey Road area and providing assurances regarding visual buffers.

neighbors.profile_summary: Private landholding trust owning multiple parcels on Pamunkey Road; no evidence of commercial activity or political advocacy.

overview_summary: Screening of 17 neighbors—comprising 12 residents and 5 organizations—reveals a landscape with 16 unknown stances and one neutral party. The profile includes one high-influence state agency with wildlife regulatory authority and three medium-influence entities, including timber companies and a telecommunications firm focused on asset value. While most individual landowners maintain low public profiles, the presence of established family trusts and commercial interests suggests that engagement should prioritize property value and operational continuity. No documented opposition exists among the profiled neighbors, as stakeholders appear driven by personal land use or financial interests rather than political advocacy.
